Economics – Changes on the labour market 
International Business School 
Hanze University of Applied Sciences, The Netherlands 



Learning objective 

Explain the effect of changes in the labour market on 
the real wage rate and quantity of labour in hours. 

2 15/5/15 



Labour market 

Supply for labour represents workers’ willingness to work at a given 
(real) wage rate. Any factor influencing the willingness of workers, 
except a change in wages, will lead to a shift of the labour supply 
curve. 
 
Possible factors: 

•  level of social benefits 
•  migration 
•  opportunity cost of leisure time  

 - diagram outside scope course

	  falls	  



Labour market 

Demand for labour represents employers / firms willingness to 
employ workers at a given (real) wage rate. Any factor influencing 
the willingness of employers to employ workers, except a change in 
wages, will lead to a shift of the labour demand curve. 
 
Possible factors: 

•  demand for a product  
•  productivity of labour 
•  price and productivity of machinery and technology (substitution)
